member.name: T:Supabase.Realtime.Channel.Push
member.summary:
Class representation of a single request sent to the Socket server.
`Push` also adds additional functionality for retrying, timeouts, and listeners for its associated response from the server.

member.name: T:Supabase.Realtime.Client
member.summary:
Singleton that represents a Client connection to a Realtime Server.
It maintains a singular Websocket with asynchronous listeners (RealtimeChannels).

member.name: P:Supabase.Realtime.Client.Subscriptions
member.summary: Exposes all Realtime RealtimeChannel Subscriptions for R/O public consumption

member.name: P:Supabase.Realtime.Client.Socket
member.summary:
The backing Socket class.
Most methods of the Client act as proxies to the Socket class.

member.name: P:Supabase.Realtime.Client.Options
member.summary: Client Options - most of which are regarding Socket connection Options

member.name: P:Supabase.Realtime.Client.SerializerSettings
member.summary:
Custom Serializer resolvers and converters that will be used for encoding and decoding Postgrest JSON responses.
By default, Postgrest seems to use a date format that C# and Newtonsoft do not like, so this initial configuration handles that.

member.name: P:Supabase.Realtime.Client.AccessToken
member.summary: JWT Access token for WALRUS security

Attempts to connect to the Socket.

member.name: T:Supabase.Realtime.RealtimeBroadcast`1
member.summary:
Represents a realtime broadcast client.
Broadcast follows the publish-subscribe pattern where a client publishes messages to a channel with a unique identifier. Other clients can elect to receive the message in real-time by subscribing to the channel with the same unique identifier. If these clients are online and subscribed then they will receive the message.
Broadcast works by connecting your client to the nearest Realtime server, which will communicate with other servers to relay messages to other clients. A common use-case is sharing a user's cursor position with other clients in an online game.

member.summary: Called when a socket message is received, parses the correct event handler to pass to.

member.name: T:Supabase.Realtime.RealtimePresence`1
member.summary:
Represents a realtime presence client.
When a client subscribes to a channel, it will immediately receive the channel's latest state in a single message. Clients are free to come-and-go as they please, and as long as they are all subscribed to the same channel then they will all have the same Presence state as each other. If a client is suddenly disconnected (for example, they go offline), their state will be automatically removed from the shared state.
